projects.title: The Meme Project
projects.description: The Meme Project is the project I am currently working on at Institute of Network Cultures. It is a multidisciplinary research on viral images, using cultural analytics practices, visual methodologies and practice-based research to develop an RDF-based ontology for memes. Click to access the Github repository.

projects.title: Digitalian Folktales
projects.description: Digitalian Folktales is the final project of the course Digital Scholarly Editing at University of Bologna. It is a tool that aims to be a critical edition of Calvino's Fiabe Italiane, a collection of different regional folktales. It allows to compare stories with the original, dialectal version, as well as to visualize a computational analysis of the language used.

projects.title: Instagram Filter x MONINGA
projects.description: I developed an Instagram filter to promote Vitamina, a music festival organized by the benefit event organization crew MONINGA Onlus in Modena, Italy. The filter uses face-tracking and changes in three variants when the user touches the screen.

projects.title: I Grandi Oggetti
projects.description: I Grandi Oggetti is the final project of the 3D animation course organized by Future Film Festival and financed by the European Social Fund. The short film is inspired by The Big Lebowski and aims to be a trailer of the movie seen through its iconic objects.

projects.title: wipEU
projects.description: wipEU is an academic open data project focused on analyzing the correlation between the representation of women in diverse positions across the European Union and its evolution over time. The project aims to examine factors influencing the presence of women in positions of Power & Decision Making in the EU.

aboutpara: I am an Anthropology graduate, Digital Humanities student and Design enthusiast. Passionate about the intersection of technology and culture and interested in new media, computer graphics, usability, cultural analytics, creative coding. I like to apply visual methodologies, computational methods and interactivity to cultural scenarios, artifacts, domains.

resume.tagline: ðŸ‘‹  I am an Anthropologist and Digital Humanist
resume.description: I research digital culture through quantitative, qualitative and visual methodologies.

experiences.position: Research and Development Intern at Institute of Network Cultures
experiences.bullets: Practice-based research on digital cultures with cultural analytics and visualizationmethods, Engaged in the development of an ontology of memes within the research project Viral Image Cultures, Design and development of an interactive interface to visualize the dataset and the ontology

experiences.position: Digital Maker at The Hmm, DEN
experiences.bullets: Selected to participate to the funded program Voices of Makers in collaboration with DEN Cultural Knowledge Institute - the program consists of four sessions that aim to map cultural digital spaces for digital transformation in the Netherlands
I served as an educator for the digital literacy of elderly individuals, conducting home visits to enhance their understanding of technology
Creator of the Vitamina Festival Instagram filter for Moninga Onlus using Blender and Meta Spark AR
Managed customer support and issue resolution, troubleshooting on Meta social media e-commerce platforms
